children: Diffuse alveolar damage. 1 = interstitial edema (thickened cellular space between airspace and vasculature); 2 = hyaline membranes (proteinaceous alveolar exudates that accumulate along the alveolar surfaces and impair gas exchange); 3 = denuded epithelium (usually numerous type 1 alveolar cells have undergone apoptosis and been replaced by hyaline membrane or fibrosis).
